availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Amos Black (Laurel County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier; 58th Regiment Kentucky Militia)

body.p: Laurel County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Black. Father of William H. Black, James Black, Samuel Black, and Elizabeth Black. Farmer in Laurel County in 1860. Third lieutenant in the 58th Regiment Kentucky Militia in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 108.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, Racoon Voting Precinct, p. 4.
Find A Grave, "Amos Black (1837-1905)," Memorial #14799734, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/14799734 (accessed May 17, 2017).
